Package ie.gmit.dip

Class QueryParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • ie.gmit.dip.Parser
      • ie.gmit.dip.QueryParser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Parsable
    public class QueryParser
extends Parser
    Since:
    1.8 The QueryParser class is used to parse a text file or URL (e.g. book, document ) based on a 'dictionary' and 'ignore words' to an object that is Indexable.

    It uses a single word a 'heading' and an associated page number as a 'locator'.

    The default number of lines (lines of text or blank spaces) per page is 40. It may be changed by using setLinesNumber method before parsing a text file.

    It maps only the words that exist in a 'dictionary'. A 'dictionary' map and an 'ignoreWords' set must be passed as an argument to the constructor.

    It ignores: - all non-words characters, - all words included in a 'ignoreWords' set passed to the constructor, - words that are not in a 'dictionary' map passed to the constructor.

    All keys in an Indexable map are in lower case.

      • QueryParser

        public QueryParser​(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> ignoreWords,
                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<WordDetails>> dictionary)
        Constructs an QueryParser object that is ready for parsing a text or file. An object is construct based on 'inoreWords' set and 'dictionary' map that are passed as an argument.
        Parameters:
        ignoreWords - a set of words to be ignored during a parsing process
        dictionary - a map words and word details.

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        public void parse​(java.io.BufferedReader br)
           throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                  java.net.MalformedURLException,
                  java.io.IOException,
                  java.lang.Exception
        Big-O notation - O(n^2)

        Parses a text file into an object that is Indexable.

        It accepts a file path or URL as an argument.

        It reads the single words from the file or URL. If the words is included in 'dictionary' map and not included in 'ignoreWords' set it is added altogether with a corresponding page to the object that is Indexable.

        The default number of lines (lines of text or blank spaces) per page is 40.

        Specified by:
        parse in interface Parsable
        Specified by:
        parse in class Parser
        Parameters:
        br - BufferedReader
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file does not exist, is a directory rather than a regular file, or for some other reason cannot be opened for reading.
        java.net.MalformedURLException - a malformed URL has occurred
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        java.lang.Exception - other exception

      • getIndexer

        public Indexable getIndexer()
        Big-O notation - O(1)

        Returns object that is Indexable and contains a map of indices.

        A map may be empty if no words were parsed to the object.

        Returns:
        object that is Indexable and contains a map of indices and WordDetails

      • setLinesNumber

        public void setLinesNumber​(int linesNumber)
        Sets the number of lines per page.
        Parameters:
        linesNumber - number of lines per page.
